title: How to Make Gluten Free Dinner Rolls

steps.headline: Sieve both flours and the baking powder into a bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix the hot water, margarine, sugar and salt until the margarine melts and the sugar and salt dissolve.
In another separate bowl, beat the egg with the milk until combined.
Add the hot water mixture to the flour mixture, then stir until combined.
Add the egg/milk mixture to the other ingredients, it should form a thick and very sticky dough.
steps.description: If your dough is too dry add some water, if it is too wet add some gluten free flour.

steps.headline: Roll pieces of dough into balls and place on a tray lined with baking paper.
steps.description: Golf ball sized pieces work well but you can make them a bit larger, just be aware that larger pieces will need to cook longer. You may wish to brush the tops with milk to make them brown better.

steps.headline: Bake for 20 minutes at 170°C (340°F), then reduce the heat to 150°C (300°F) and bake for a further 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and allow to cool, best eaten while still warm.

text: Preheat the oven to 170°C (340°F).  Sieve both flours and the baking powder into a bowl.  In a separate bowl, mix the hot water, margarine, sugar and salt until the margarine melts and the sugar and salt dissolve.  In another separate bowl, beat the egg with the milk until combined.  Add the hot water mixture to the flour mixture, then stir until combined.  Add the egg/milk mixture to the other ingredients, it should form a thick and very sticky dough. If your dough is too dry add some water, if it is too wet add some gluten free flour. Roll pieces of dough into balls and place on a tray lined with baking paper. Golf ball sized pieces work well but you can make them a bit larger, just be aware that larger pieces will need to cook longer. You may wish to brush the tops with milk to make them brown better. Bake for 20 minutes at 170°C (340°F), then reduce the heat to 150°C (300°F) and bake for a further 10 minutes.  Remove from oven and allow to cool, best eaten while still warm.
